page.title: 08K.E.G.S.,Chelmsford (1)
page.content: The history of the school dates from {1375}when Sir{John Mounteney}endowed a Grammar School.In{1551 King Edward VI issued a warrant for the endowment of a free{Grammar }School.The site of the school was at{Moulsham Friary,}but in {1633}the roof of the hall collapsed due to decay.The governors purchased a site in{Duke Street}on which they built a{new room}and a{Headmaster's {house.}By{1851}due to competition from other schools,the number of{pupils had {fallen to 7}and in{1853}the{school {closed}for{3 years.}When it reopened the numbers grew rapidly and a{new {school}was opened on the present site in{Broomfield Road}in{1892. In{1949}the school came under the control of{Essex Education Authority and in{1976 girls}were admitted for the first time but were only allowed in the{sixth form.
